p: A closely related challenge is that awareness among the general public of the environmental burden of meat production and consumption is still low [ 7, 66, 67, 68]. Furthermore, some consumers perceive soy products to have a similar environmental impact to meat [ 8]. The authors argue that a possible explanation for this is that soy production for livestock feed is a major cause of deforestation in Brazil, which the public confuses with soy for human consumption. Despite these results, public opinion has likely shifted in recent years as a result of consistent efforts by public organisms, institutions and NGOs to raise awareness over the environmental impact of meat and animal products [ 68].
